Like in most of ShakespearesShakespeare's sonnets he goes after the same pattern and formal structure.

Shakespeare has another good way to introduce a different part in his sonnet which is called a volta.
Here the volta is in e.g. and is pointed out by the word but.
In this sonnet the but changes the view of perspective from the lyrical speaker and introduces a new perspective to think about for the reader.
Another tool he likslikes to work with to clarify his opinion or view on poetic devices, that shows his first device, which is a metaphor, in l. 1 she is made of truth.
Here he wants the lyrical speaker points out that his love is made of truth, so she does not lie.
thisThis is mentioned so the reader has something about the woman he is going to talk about.
In line two is aan antithesis I do believe, though iI know she lies?.
With that sentence the lyrical speaker wants to illustrate that even tough he knows that she is made of truth, he believes her because he loves her.
Here the author wants to make the reader clear that everyone lies sometimes and you just have to accept it.
Furthermore there is a personification in l. 7 her false speaking tongue with the author means the lies of his loved one.
This just again shows the reader the character of the woman mentioned.
The reader can maybe now picture as a person.
The next device is a repititionrepetition in ll. 9-10 But wherefore says she not she is unjust and wherefore say not I that I am old.
In these two sentencesShakespeare even uses two rhetorical questions.
At this point in the sonnet the way of perspective changes and the lyrical speaker shows us the different part of his thoughts.
This shows the reader that the person you love is not always right and that you can have an opinion yourself.
The last poetic device is in the last line of the sonnet and it is a metaphor (l. 19) In our faults by lies we flatter'd be.
To finish ofoff the sonnet the lyrical speaker makes a final statement where he points out that between two lovers both know that theirthere are lies but they do not care and just play along.
